modName: Rings of Constant Effect Light and Night Eye
summary: Adds 2 constant effect rings into the game - Ring of Floating Light (Candlelight spell effect) and Ring of Night Eye (Night Eye effect). Purchase them from Farengar in Whiterun, or you may find them in other vendors too (levelled lists for lvl 10 and 20 respectively).
descriptionHtml:
[color=red][size=4]Description[/size][/color]
If you\'re using any sort of mod to make nights and dungeons darker and \"more realistic\", you will soon find that you can\'t really see that well
in the dark.

I created this as a sort of cheat since torches tend to burn out and the Candlelight spell lasts only 1 minute.

As for Night Eye, I have never seen a spell tome for it, so I can only assume it\'s a power (racial or otherwise) that other races do not have.

So, I made 2 rings that have these 2 effects as constant power. As long as you have them equipped, you will get either the Night Eye power or the Candlelight power.

These 2 items are also added to levelled lists at level 10 for Candlelight ring and level 20 for Night Eye ring.

[color=red][size=4]Where to get them[/size][/color]
Buy these rings from Farengar in Dragonsreach, in Whiterun.

[color=red][size=4]Compatibility[/size][/color]
This mod does not use any scripts so it should not cause any savegame bloat and/or corruption. All the effects are taken from vanilla Skyrim.

[u]Possible conflicts with mods that modify:[/u]
1 - levelled items lists (Economics of Skyrim mod maybe?)
2 - Farengar\'s chest, where he keeps his for-sale inventory

[color=red][size=4]Installation[/size][/color]
[color=yellow]Manual[/color] - Just drop the file into your Skyrim\\Data folder and activate it.
[color=yellow]NMM [/color] - Should be striaghtforward install

[color=red][size=4]Uninstallation[/size][/color]
Just deactivate and remove/delete from your Skyrim\\Data folder. 

[color=red][size=4]Changelog[/size][/color]
1.2 - Increased Floating Light radius from vanilla \"450\" to \"1000\". Meaning Ring 
	  of Floating Light now shines further. Ring of Night Eye has no perceptible 
	  difference even after I increased radius to 128 from 32, so I didn\'t make any 
	  changes it. You can see the difference for yourself by casting the vanilla
	  \"Candlelight\" spell and then putting on the Floating Light ring to compare the
	  distances.

1.1 - Allows items to be disenchanted, to let player re-enchant another
	  item(s) of their choice.
	  
1.0 - Initial release
author: elite403

files.name: ConstantEffectRings_11
files.changelogHtml: Allows rings to be disenchanted, letting players re-enchant another item of their choice

files.name: ConstantEffectRings_12
files.changelogHtml: 1.2 - Increased Floating Light radius from vanilla "450" to "1000". Meaning Ring of Floating Light now shines further.
